0P00007190.TO.summary: The fundamental investment objective of this Fund is to provide long-term capital growth by investing primarily in equity securities listed on recognized stock exchanges of countries in Asia and the Pacific Rim, including Hong Kong SAR, Taiwan, South Korea, Singapore, China, Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia, the Philippines and Australia, but excluding Japan.

0P0000KS1J.TO.long_name: Canada Life Far East Equity (CLI) GensII
0P0000KS1J.TO.summary: This segregated fund invests all of its assets in the Mackenzie Focus Far East Class, a mutual fund managed by Mackenzie Financial Corporation. Mackenzie Focus Far East Class pursues long-term capital growth by investing in a concentrated portfolio of Asian equity securities (excluding Japanese securities). The fund may invest in securities traded in Hong Kong, South Korea, Taiwan, China, Malaysia, Indonesia, Philippines, New Zealand, India, Pakistan, Thailand and other Asian markets. The fund uses a multi-manager investment strategy of between two and six portfolio teams, selected by Mackenzie, to manage the fund's portfolio investments.

0P0000OMTL.TO.summary: The fundamental investment objective of this Fund is to provide long-term capital growth by investing primarily in equity securities listed on recognized stock exchanges of countries in Asia and the Pacific Rim, including Hong Kong SAR, Taiwan, South Korea, Singapore, China, Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia, the Philippines and Australia, but excluding Japan.

0P0000SR8Q.TO.long_name: Assumption/Fidelity Far East Fund Series B
0P0000SR8Q.TO.summary: This segregated fund invests in the Fidelity Far East Fund. The underlying fund invests primarily in equity securities of companies located in countries in Southeast Asia excluding Japan.
0P0000SR8Q.TO.manager_bio: Eileen Dibb is lead portfolio manager, Asia Growth Strategies at Fidelity Institutional Asset Management (FIAM). In this role, she is responsible for FIAM Asian Growth strategies including FIAM Japan Growth and FIAM Pac Basin Growth. Ms. Dibb joined Fidelity in 2005 and has been in the industry since 1996. Ms. Dibb earned her bachelor of arts degree from Bucknell University and her master of business administration degree from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania. She is a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) charterholder.
